titleStmt.title: H. M. Redd et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos. E. Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners citizens of McCracken County Respectfully represent to your Excellency - that one Freeling now in state penetentiary was sent there from McCracken County upon charges of making an assault upon a woman with intent to committ a rape. We do not believe he had any such intention- she was seen to kiss him before the offence complained of. We think his a hard case - he has served some three or four years already- and we believe he is a proper subject for the exercise of Executive clemency - which we respectfully ask on his behalf and as matter of Justice to one whom we believe was improperly convicted.

H. M. Redd
R. T. Boon
E R Bradshaw
G. F. Kelly
C Barkman
J H Gandrum
B. H. Milliken
Wm W. Herndon
John P Hart
Gov Bramlette_ I defended Mr Freeling on the above charge and I candidly believe he was convicted mor through excitement, than from evidence, and I would be gratified to have him pardoned.

John Q. A. King
D. D. Husbands
T. J Birchett
W. H. Thompson
J. A. M. Hobbs
J K Hobbs
W L Sullivan
J. J. McIntosh
W. J. Agnew
J. W. Ogilvie
G W Ratcliffe
J. W. Cole
L S Garnett
G. Y. Barnes
William C. Start
Josiah Harris Jr
W A Petere
G. W. Thompson
B H Shanklin
A Loveless

T J Atkins

Sam Williamson

Sargeant Moss

Wm Williams
W M Saillors
Benet
M Edw Wharton
M. M Petree
J B Walker
G. W. Kirke
John Merideth
James Venner
W. T. Phillips
Wm Merit
T.. W.. Clark
James Clark
D. M. Clark
F. G. Gilbert
L S Ellithorp
U F Ellithorp
T. J. Mchall
Daniel Marshall
J W Allen

Cap. A
John. A. Miller
W. V. Hicks
J C Miller
J. G. Fisher
S Leonard
J. S. Smedly
E. M. Birchett
J. W. Cooksey
L. Wray
M. Ochlschlager
W. W. Straud
J. W. Harrison
Wilson Thompson
W. L. H. Ross
I Sertify to what J Q A King has said as I was presant it the cort that he was tried in T. J. Birchett R. P.

McCracken Cir Ct
vs
W. Freeling
Issue Pardon
Tho E Bramlette
26th Apl/64
